discussion.content: B & E are correct, just confirmed it.

questions.question_text: Which two are direct benefits of the multiprocess, multithreaded architecture of Oracle Database 12c when it is enabled?
You want to back up a database such that only formatted blocks are backed up. Which statement is true about this backup operation?

choices.A: The backup must be performed in mount state.
choices.B: The tablespace must be taken offline.
choices.D: The database must be backed up as an image copy.
choices.C: All files must be backed up as backup sets.

discussion.content: A is very controversial answer. It creates a big cataclysm among DBAs.

comments.content: Thanks! i confirmed C is the correct

discussion.content: i couldnt remember exactly if read this from my 062 book. looks like this question is for 062

choices.D: all users except sys, system, and scott
choices.C: all users except sys and scott

choices.E: It is set to all for all PDBs only in the SPFILE.
choices.C: It is immediately set to all only for cd3Sroot.
choices.D: It is immediately set to all in all PDBs where the statistics_level parameter is not set.
choices.A: It is immediately set to all in the SPFILE and the CDB instance.
choices.B: It is immediately set to all in only those pluggable databases (PDBs) where the value is set to typical.

comments.content:
Right on the spot. A D are correct.

When the STATISTICS_LEVEL parameter is modified by ALTER SYSTEM, all advisories or statistics are dynamically turned on or off, depending on the new value of STATISTICS_LEVEL. When modified by ALTER SESSION, the following advisories or statistics are turned on or off in the local session only. Their system-wide state is not changed.

choices.A: by using the connect statement as a local user having only the set container privilege
choices.E: by executing the alter session set container command as a local user
choices.D: as a common user with the set container privilege

questions.question_text:
You are administering a multitenant container database (CDB).
Identify two ways to access a pluggable database (PDB) that is open in read-only mode.

comments.content: I think the SET CONTAINER privilige is for common users only
